newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Directors recommend US bid for McCollam.
newsitem.headline: Directors recommend US bid for McCollam.

text.p: The independent directors of New Zealand's McCollam Printers Limited have recommended shareholders accept a takeover offer priced at NZ$2.75 per share after an outside report called it fair.
"Taking account of the independent advice which they obtained, the independent directors consider the offer is fair and recommend that you accept it," they said in a statement.

Merrill Lynch carried out a valuation of McCollam's at the directors' request after Blue Star Investments, part of U.S. Office Products Co, gave notice on May 16 that it would be launching a takeover offer at $2.75 each, subject to an as-yet unannounced separate deal with family shareholders.
"A copy of the recommendation has been sent to Blue Star for inclusion in the offer document, which we understand will be sent to shareholders (later this) week," they added.
McCollam's shares closed on Friday at $2.73 and last week Blue Star said it had been buying shares in the market at about that price.
Monday was a market holiday in New Zealand.
